byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Cairo, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva. Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukalla, Yemen, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

abstract: United Nations' human rights chief Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein warns Yemen is on verge of ruin and collapse, with heavy fighting in city of Aden; Saudi-led offensive targets suspected Houthi militia sites.
lead_paragraph: The warning came amid reports of heavy fighting in the port city of Aden that had left streets lined with bodies and hospitals full of corpses.

headline.main: Aid for Yemen Dwindles as Need Rises Amid Chaos
headline.print_headline: Aid Dwindles as Need Rises Amid Chaos in Yemen

snippet: The warning came amid reports of heavy fighting in the port city of Aden that had left streets lined with bodies and hospitals full of corpses.
